newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Seapower says CADTIC ceased business.
newsitem.headline: Seapower says CADTIC ceased business.

text.p: Seapower International Holdings Ltd said its second largest shareholder, China Agribusiness Development Trust & Investment Corp (CADTIC), which holds 19.35 percent of the company, had ceased its business.
The company said in a joint statement with Seapower Resources International Ltd and Paramount Publishing Group Ltd that "they have been informed of the cessation of business" of CADTIC.
"The Seapower Group has not been informed on the details of the cessation of business of CADTIC," the statement said.
The statement said Seapower Group has not been informed of any proposed transfer of CADTIC's shares in Seapower International or any proposed change in directors of the group.
CADTIC had appointed three directors on the board of Seapower International.

Seapower International, which is about 39.15 percent controlled by chairman Choi Sai Leung as in January 1996, holds a controlling 41.67 percent of Seapower Resources and 63.12 percent of Paramount Publishing.
The statement said CADTIC did not hold any shares in Seapower Resources and Paramount.
"The directors of the Seapower Group presently do not expect any adverse impact on the Seapower Group's day-to-day ooperation," it said.
The group said they will make further statements when further details related to the cessation of business of CADTIC is available.
Shares of Seapower International fell HK$0.25 to HK$2.60 in mid-morning on Thursday, Seapower Resources was unchanged at HK$0.75, and Paramount was untraded at HK$0.98.
